etymology.description: Pictogram (象形): 首 + 卩 – head of a kneeling person, emphasising “head”.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a kneeling figure with the head highlighted, conveying the idea of 'head'. Later it was borrowed to write 'page/sheet' (via the popular form of 葉), while the original 'head' sense survives mainly in the radical and historical usage.
etymology.simplification: Simplified by adopting the cursive-derived graph 页 from 頁, reducing strokes for easier writing; meaning remained the same.

examples.chinese: 请翻到第三页(請翻到第三頁)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng fān dào dì sān yè.

examples.chinese: 这本书的页码印错了(這本書的頁碼印錯了)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè běn shū de yèmǎ yìn cuò le.
examples.english: The page numbers in this book were misprinted.

examples.chinese: 这个网页打不开(這個網頁打不開)。
